definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a high-grade white cardboard, most commonly made by pasting together sheets of heavy ledger paper. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a high-grade white cardboard, most commonly made by pasting together sheets of heavy ledger paper. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a closely woven textile made in various weights, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a support for painting or printing; or a loosely woven, lattice-like mesh, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a needlepoint foundation. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a closely woven textile made in various weights, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a support for painting or printing; or a loosely woven, lattice-like mesh, usually of flax, hemp, jute, or cotton, used as a needlepoint foundation. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a type of stiff sheet typically made of good-quality chemical pulp or rag pulp, varying greatly in type and strength, and that is thicker than 0.006 inches. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a type of stiff sheet typically made of good-quality chemical pulp or rag pulp, varying greatly in type and strength, and that is thicker than 0.006 inches. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, fired at a high temperature to form a hard, brittle, heat- and corrosion-resistant material. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, fired at a high temperature to form a hard, brittle, heat- and corrosion-resistant material. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of silicon dioxide (silica) fused with one or more basic oxides; generally transparent but often translucent or opaque. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of silicon dioxide (silica) fused with one or more basic oxides; generally transparent but often translucent or opaque. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of any firm, dense, rigid board, often manufactured from fiber consolidated in a hot press. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of any firm, dense, rigid board, often manufactured from fiber consolidated in a hot press. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of laminated paper board that has paper layers glued to its surface; used commonly as temporary artists' supports. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of laminated paper board that has paper layers glued to its surface; used commonly as temporary artists' supports. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of the dentine forming the bulk of the teeth and tusks of animals such as elephants, walruses, and narwhals. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of the dentine forming the bulk of the teeth and tusks of animals such as elephants, walruses, and narwhals. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of the skin or hide of an animal that has been tanned to render it resistant to putrefaction and relatively soft and flexible when dry. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of the skin or hide of an animal that has been tanned to render it resistant to putrefaction and relatively soft and flexible when dry. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a substance typified by being a good conductor of electricity and heat, opaque with a characteristic lustre, fusible, and usually malleable or ductile. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a substance typified by being a good conductor of electricity and heat, opaque with a characteristic lustre, fusible, and usually malleable or ductile. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of thin material made from felted sheets or webs of animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic fibres formed and dried from a suspension in water. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of thin material made from felted sheets or webs of animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic fibres formed and dried from a suspension in water. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of calf, sheep, or goat skin which has been prepared to produce a thin, strong, translucent or opaque substance for writing, bookbinding, or other uses. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of calf, sheep, or goat skin which has been prepared to produce a thin, strong, translucent or opaque substance for writing, bookbinding, or other uses. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: An applied material or base material consisting of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate (gypsum) or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: An applied material or base material consisting of a powder prepared from calcium sulphate dihydrate (gypsum) or calcium carbonate and mixed with water and sometimes a filler to form a paste that liberates heat and then hardens. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: An applied material or base material consisting of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: An applied material or base material consisting of synthetic or semi-synthetic organic polymers of high molecular weight that are moldable. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of a refractory white clay (kaolin) and a feldspathic rock that is heated to form a ceramic material. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of a refractory white clay (kaolin) and a feldspathic rock that is heated to form a ceramic material. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of lac, a resinous substance excreted by the female lac insect, that can be dissolved in ethyl alcohol to form a liquid that can be applied with a brush. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of lac, a resinous substance excreted by the female lac insect, that can be dissolved in ethyl alcohol to form a liquid that can be applied with a brush. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of the integument of animals, such as sheep, goats, or calves, separated from the body and variously processed to remove hair, dry, tan, or otherwise dress. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material consisting of rock in its naturally occurring shape or that has been cut, shaped, crushed, or otherwise formed. (Deprecated)
ToolkitDefinition_en: A base material consisting of rock in its naturally occurring shape or that has been cut, shaped, crushed, or otherwise formed. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: A base material created by processing man-made materials, usually as a substitute for a natural material. (Deprecated)

definition[0]_en: An applied material or a base material consisting of a chemical compound from an animal, plant, mineral, or synthetic source that is malleable near ambient temperatures, slightly greasy to the touch, with a low melting point, and usually translucent, water-repellant, and soluble in organic solvents.
